Query: How to rip DVD's in high quality

Answers.MP Summary: write data to optical disk media
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Burn a file to the disc in an optical drive, potentially writing to multiple discs in succession
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_174626: How do I burn a DVD ISO using the terminal?
ul_622660: Checking my DVD's current reading speed
au_423471: Best way to burn data to dvd using command line
Top-3 Scripts:
au_174626: wodim -eject -tao  speed=2 dev=/dev/sr1 -v -data myiso.iso

wodim -prcap dev=/dev/sr1

man wodim

Explanations about Options.-prcap:
Print the drive capabilities for SCSI-3/mmc compliant drives as obtained from mode
 page 0x2A. Values marked with kB use 1000 bytes as kilo-byte, values marked with KB
 use 1024 bytes as Kilo-byte.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Convert MP4 video to VP9 codec. For the best quality, use a CRF value (recommended range 15-35) and -b:video MUST be 0
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1189174: How do I use FFmpeg and rav1e to create high quality AV1 files?
au_45025: Converting panasonic .MTS video into high quality mpeg videos?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_1189174: ffmpeg -i sintel_trailer_2k_720p24.y4m -i sintel_trailer-audio.flac \
       -c:v librav1e -qp 80 -speed 4 \
       -tile-columns 2 -tile-rows 2 \
       -c:a libfdk_aac -b:a 128k \
       sintel_trailer_av1.mp4
au_45025: ffmpeg -i your_file.MTS -acodec copy -vcodec libx264 -crf 21 -r 30000/1001 -deinterlace -vpre lossless_medium -y -threads 0 output_file.avi

Explanations about Options.-t:
When used as an input option (before "-i"), limit the duration of data read from the
 input file.
Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-vcodec: Set the video codec. This is an alias for "-codec:v".
Explanations about Options.-h:
Show help. An optional parameter may be specified to print help about a specific item.
 If no argument is specified, only basic (non advanced) tool options are shown.
Explanations about Options.-n:
Do not overwrite output files, and exit immediately if a specified output file already
 exists.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Eject a specific device (the default order is cd-rom, scsi, floppy and tape)
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1211780: is there a way to set handbrake to eject the tray after ripping a dvd?
ul_4410: How do I copy DVDs
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_4410: dd if=/dev/dvd of=saved.iso

for i in {1..20}; do
    eject /dev/dvd
    read -p 'Insert disc and press RETURN: '
    eject -t /dev/dvd
    growisofs -Z /dev/dvd=saved.iso
done
eject /dev/dvd

Explanations about Options.-t:
With this option the drive is given a CD-ROM tray close command. Not all devices
 support this command.
